children.text: The tiles have not been properly aligned flush across their top surfaces and are currently lipped.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3958.1 Ceramic Tiles - Guide to the Installation of Ceramic Tiles, Clause 5.4.6 - Tile Finish and Joints states that
‘The lippage between two adjacent tiles for joint widths of 3.0mm or less the lippage should not exceed 1.0mm’ .
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 11.08 Uneven tiling states that
‘Except where tiles have distortions inherent in the manufacture, tiling is defective if it has joints that are not uniform, of even width, aligned or in the same plane’ .
These tiles will have to be removed and re-laid so that they are properly aligned across their finished surfaces in accordance with the above requirements.
